intro: Dorstenia tenuis, commonly known as the slender-dorstena, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spiral-shaped leaves that are often folded or rolled. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Dorstenia tenuis is adapted to grow in shaded, humid environments, often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after species among horticulturists and plant enthusiasts.
